template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a {business_type} that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a multi-case customer support automation workflow for a managed hosting provider that involves triage, automatic resolution of simple issues, escalation of complex cases, and performance tracking; output only the prompt text under 40 words.

message.content: Design a system that triages hosting support tickets, auto-resolves common issues, escalates complex cases, and tracks resolution performance.
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, the user wants a single-sentence prompt under 40 words for a customer support automation workflow. Let me break down their requirements: managed hosting provider, triage, automatic resolution for simple issues, escalation for complex cases, and performance tracking.  

I need to combine all these elements concisely. Start with the workflow steps: triage first, then automation for simple issues, escalation for complex ones. Finally, include tracking for efficiency.  

Keeping it under 40 words means avoiding extra details. Maybe structure it as a command: "Create a workflow that..." or "Design a system..." Wait, the example uses "Design a system..." That flows well. Let me check the word count. "Design a system that triages hosting support tickets, auto-resolves common issues, escalates complex cases, and tracks resolution performance." That’s 19 words. Perfect.  

Did I miss anything? Triage, auto-resolution, escalation, tracking—all covered. The phrasing is direct and fits the user’s plain-English request. No jargon, just clear steps. Yeah, this should work.
